intro: Rochea flava, commonly known as the yellow rochea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a compact cluster, making it visually striking. Rochea flava is often found in rocky or arid environments, adapting well to poor soil conditions. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
